title: Decision-Making Process Workshop for Collaborative Learning Design

context.prior_knowledge: Basic mathematics education theories and understanding of instructional design frameworks
context.additional_context: Teaching competency enhancement course for pre-service or in-service teachers; simulation-based training where pre-service teachers collaboratively make decisions with learners in mathematical problem-solving classes

learning_goals: Apply a collaborative decision-making model (3 stages: analysis-negotiation-implementation) to resolve over 80% of conflicts in math lesson design
Create assessment rubrics that incorporate principles of social justice (fairness, inclusivity, participation) in learning design decisions
Utilize collaborative tools to coordinate decision-making with peer teachers in real-time under limited technological environments (smartphones)

resources: Open-Source Math Problem Bank for Education
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
